Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of athletic scene; from left, trace of bottom of garment and foot to right; nude male moving rapidly right (upper torso and head missing; left leg advanced; arms spreadeagled); right leg of second male moving right; below, one brownish band above black lower bowl. Repair hole at bottom.
Curator's comments: Beazley wrote that 1965,0930.764 and British Museum 1965, 0930.762 and 1965,0930.763 belonged with British Museum 1888,0601.594.b, but these sherds come from a different cup or cups, as they are thicker and have a different curvature.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 400, no. B592)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 235, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0481) (Phase 1)
